com.wealdtech.hawk

Class Hawk

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wealdtech.hawk.Hawk

  • public class Hawk
extends java.lang.Object
    The Hawk class provides helper methods for calculating the MAC, required by both clients and servers.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateMAC

        public static java.lang.String calculateMAC(HawkCredentials credentials,
                            Hawk.AuthType authType,
                            java.lang.Long timestamp,
                            java.net.URI uri,
                            java.lang.String nonce,
                            java.lang.String method,
                            java.lang.String hash,
                            java.lang.String ext,
                            java.lang.String app,
                            java.lang.String dlg)
        Calculate and return a MAC. The MAC is used to sign the method and parameters passed as part of a request. It forms the basis to allow the server to verify that the request has not been tampered with.

        Note that there is no validation of the parameters except to confirm that mandatory parameters are not null.

        Parameters:
        credentials - Hawk credentials of the requestor
        authType - The type of the MAC to calculate
        timestamp - timestamp of the request
        uri - URI of the request, including query parameters if appropriate
        nonce - nonce a random string used to uniquely identify the request
        method - the HTTP method of the request
        hash - a hash of the request's payload, or null if payload authentication is not required
        ext - optional extra data, as supplied by the requestor to differentiate the request if required
        app - application ID, used for Oz
        dlg - delegator, used for Oz
        Returns:
        the MAC
        Throws:
        com.wealdtech.DataError - if there is an issue with the data that prevents creation of the MAC

      • calculateTSMac

        public static java.lang.String calculateTSMac(long curtime)

      • calculateBodyMac

        public static java.lang.String calculateBodyMac(HawkCredentials credentials,
                                java.lang.String contentType,
                                java.lang.String body)
        Generate the MAC for a body with a specific content-type
        Parameters:
        credentials - Hawk credentials of the requestor
        contentType - the MIME content type
        body - the body
        Returns:
        the MAC
        Throws:
        com.wealdtech.DataError - if there is an issue with the data that prevents creation of the MAC

      • calculateMac

        public static java.lang.String calculateMac(HawkCredentials credentials,
                            java.lang.String text)
        Internal method to generate the MAC given the compiled string to sign
        Parameters:
        credentials - Hawk credentials of the requestor
        text - the compiled string
        Returns:
        the MAC
        Throws:
        com.wealdtech.DataError - if there is an issue with the data that prevents creation of the MAC

      • generateBewit

        public static java.lang.String generateBewit(HawkCredentials credentials,
                             java.net.URI uri,
                             java.lang.Long ttl,
                             java.lang.String ext)
        Calculate and return a bewit. The bewit is used to allow access to a resource when passed to a suitable Hawk server.
        Parameters:
        credentials - Hawk credentials of the requestor
        uri - URI of the request, including query parameters if appropriate
        ttl - the time to live for the bewit, in seconds
        ext - optional extra data, as supplied by the requestor to differentiate the request if required
        Returns:
        the MAC
        Throws:
        com.wealdtech.DataError - if there is an issue with the data that prevents creation of the MAC
